items.title: #46: Fresh, `wasmbuild`, and v1.23.2
items.content_html:
Deno News #46: Fresh, `wasmbuild`, and v1.23.2

The big news in the past two weeks is the v1.0 release of Fresh! It uses SSR, just-in-time rendering, and island-based hydration, with no build step. Here are some reactions from Twitter:

Everyone: our builds got 50% faster@deno_land: we have no builds

ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

â€” AdriÃ¡n Mato ğŸ™ (@adrianmg) June 28, 2022

okay, @deno_landâ€˜s new web framework â€œfreshâ€ is actually so clean

I need to build something nowww

â€” Tomasz Zdanowski (@tzdanows) June 30, 2022

You had me at â€œzero JS by defaultâ€:https://t.co/C6A1VDD5Fh

â€” Alex Russell (@slightlylate) June 15, 2022

And if you havenâ€™t checked out Fresh, hereâ€™s a 3min recap video from the one and only Fireship.

Articles and Resources

Announcing Fresh v1.0 â€” Luca Casonato â€” Denoâ€™s official announcement about Fresh v1.0 with examples to get started.

NEW FRAMEWORK Makes Remix And NextJS Feel Slow?? Fresh by Deno is FAST (Youtube) â€” Theo - ping.gg â€” In this 28min video, Theo explains Deno, SSR/SSG (with diagrams!), and how Fresh works.

How to Fresh (Youtube) â€” Coding with Robby â€” An excellent 20 min introduction to building a website with Fresh.

wasmbuild - Using Rust in Deno and Web Apps â€” David Sherret â€” wasmbuild is a module that enables developers to build Rust for Deno or the Web with only Rustâ€™s toolchain and Deno installed, meaning less setup steps for your contributors.

Deno ã§ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’é›‘ã«ä½œã£ãŸã®ã§æ„Ÿæƒ³ â€” sosukesuzuki â€” Prettier maintainer gives his first impressions on Deno.

Fresh: The Next-Gen JavaScript Web Framework â€” Harsh Singh â€” A brief, but insightful overview of Freshâ€™s features, such as SSR, JIT rendering, and island-based hydration.

Code and Tools

  • Deno v1.23.2 â€” Minor bug fixes and FFI improvements.
  • bebo â€” Run Clojure scripts on Deno.
  • http_response_helpers â€” Simple helper functions to create Fetch API Response objects.
  • fast â€” A fast, minimal web framework in less than 200 LOC.
  • r2d2 â€” Simple, lightweight Redis client library for Deno.
  • zipland â€” Serve file server with single zip file as file system in Deno.
  • atlas_sdk â€”A typeâ€“safe MongoDB Atlas SDK for Deno.
  • hono â€” A web framework for Cloudflare Workers, but with the recent v1.6 release, now supports Deno.
  • crayon â€” A terminal-styling module written in TypeScript.
  • fortuna â€” A weighted gacha system.
  • piwo â€” A command line HTTP client written in Deno.
  • deno_python â€” Python interpreter bindings for Deno.
  • webview_deno â€” New release v0.7.3 fixes the pre-built executables for Linux in addition to adding support for the Apple M1 platform.
  • mock-file â€” A synchronous file system API polyfill for Deno Deploy.
  • emoji â€” A utility module for all things emoji.

Odds and Ends

  • Why a dinosaur is running my JavaScript code?
  • Bundle any Deno module on the fly into standard JS module.
  • Nick Taylor interviews Luca Casonato about Deno and Fresh (Youtube).

And thatâ€™s it for this issue!

Know someone who might find this useful? Please forward this to them.

And if you have any feedback and comments, just hit reply!

â€“ Andy

Article URL: https://buttondown.email/denonews/archive/46-fresh-wasmbuild-and-v1232/
